Stop hiring developers based on green dots in GitHub profiles. The best developers I know are not even on GitHub. They develop closed-source apps on platforms like GitLab. Git activity shows quantity, not quality. Measure developers based on the value they bring to a repo, not by how often they commit to a repo.

Want to apply real world AI to marketing use cases? We're hiring AI engineers for our marketing team! See the role here: 

Diana Smith

VP of Marketing [...] This is probably the coolest role I have hired for on my team (with maybe the exception of hiring Hana Hassan to lead brand at Twilioorg). We are looking for an Applied AI Engineer to join the marketing team at LangChain! This person will get to build the future of marketing, on top of LangChain frameworks and products. You'll be a top internal customer and influence the product roadmap. Together, we will figure out what needs to be different if we embrace AI in marketing from the early innings of building a team. We're hiring for this role because we know we can't just repeat the SaaS marketing playbook and be successful today. We could buy a bunch of AI-native GTM tools. And maybe we will at some point. But a buy-first approach does not feel right for us as an organization leading the

data.title: R. C. Sproul - Wikipedia
data.snippet:
Gerstner convinced Sproul to study under G. C. Berkouwer at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (Free University of Amsterdam) in Holland, where he initiated study in 1964. Sproul was granted leave in 1965 due to his wife's second pregnancy and mother's illness (during which he was appointed to teach philosophy at Westminster College "Westminster College (Pennsylvania)")), and later resumed study at distance. He returned to Holland in 1969 to receive a doctorandus degree.

He married Vesta Voorhis in 1960 and had two children, Sherrie Dorotiak and Robert Craig Sproul.

Sproul was a passenger on the Amtrak train that derailed in the 1993 Big Bayou Canot train wreck, and sometimes gave firsthand accounts of the story.

## Career

[edit] [...] ## Career

[edit]

Under Sproul's direction, Ligonier Ministries produced the Ligonier Statement on Biblical Inerrancy, which would eventually grow into the 1978 Chicago Statement on Biblical Inerrancy. Along with Norman Geisler, Sproul was one of the chief architects of the statement. [...] Robert Charles Sproul (/spro äl/ SPROHL; February 13, 1939 ‚Äì December 14, 2017) was an American Reformed theologian, Christian apologist, and ordained pastor in the Presbyterian Church in America. He was the founder and chairman of Ligonier Ministries, and could be heard daily on the Renewing Your Mind radio broadcast internationally.

data.title: How LangChain Found a Trusted Partner for Their Sandbox Needs
data.snippet:
As a leader in open‚Äësource agent development, LangChain‚Äôs bread and butter is building, orchestrating, and deploying agents seamlessly for developers and non‚Äëtechnical users alike. To advance this mission, Brace Sproul, Head of Applied AI, and his team built a cloud‚Äëhosted coding agent that runs autonomously end to end. To open-source it reliably, they needed to nail one thing: their sandbox partner. [...] #### If anybody asked me which runtime platform to use, I'm going to 100% say Daytona every time. With their SDK, we never have to worry about an agent leaking or taking actions that it shouldn't. I haven't seen this anywhere else.

Brace Sproul

Head of Applied AI at LangChain

###### MORE CUSTOMER STORIES

##### How Stanford‚Äôs CS Department Accelerates Open-Source Agent Development With Daytona

##### How Stanford‚Äôs CS Department Accelerates Open-Source Agent Development With Daytona

##### How Stanford‚Äôs CS Department Accelerates Open-Source Agent Development With Daytona##### How Orchids Powers the World's First AI Full-Stack Engineer With Daytona

##### How Orchids Powers the World's First AI Full-Stack Engineer With Daytona [...] langchain.com

langchain.com

Linkedin

Linkedin

Linkedin

Learn how the leading open-source agent engineering platform partnered with Daytona to ensure secure, instant, and persistent sandboxes for their production-ready coding agent.

#### Our mission is to be the one place developers go for all their agent needs. Daytona is the only tech partner that could support our sandbox needs and make this possible.

Brace Sproul

Head of Applied AI at LangChain

###### 01 -- CHALLENGE

### Deploying Open-Source Coding Agents Called for a Reliable Sandbox Infrastructure Partner
